title: Check-in Call (First Thursday of Month)

checkInFormat.description: First Thursdays of every month, structured check-in routine
rules: No traffic cop - volunteers step forward
No comments back and forth during check-ins
Moratorium on chat during check-ins (can save but don't send)
Pauses are appreciated - like Quaker Meeting
Be moderately brief - check in on something OGM-y
Don't empty entire brain of everything banked for the week
checkInFormat.philosophy: Quiet moments are not awkward, they're appreciative

kevinJones.update: Hurricane Helene continued - finding new role helping Swannanoa
keyPoints: Gave up on FEMA, moved to River Arts District apartment
Lost $1M on land and house
Met with woman leading 'outside safety net' work - Swannanoa Cares
7 people working, 3 former Airbnb cleaners now paid social workers
Leader had to escape to south of France for 2 weeks, came back
Devastation remains, low-status neighborhood, county doing nothing
Creating 'third place' - Eleanor Ostrom: watersheds 47% better managed when ranchers have regular meeting place
No grocery, post office, hardware, restaurants - all gone
Fighting land rush - was $100K/house and $300/rent cheaper before flood
Can work with people on problems without being down in sadness
River Arts District artists determined to work in live-work lofts, not sad
Some people can be around sad, Kevin couldn't
Looking at community investment funds, working without federal government
Gardens covered by sand dunes
kevinJones.tone: Mixed - still traumatized but finding constructive role, little encouraging
kevinJones.evolution: Progressing from pure trauma (Calls 01-02) to finding purpose while avoiding sadness

gilFriend.update: Concussion recovery - body-focused week, forced rest
keyPoints: Fell Sunday, sustained mild concussion
Over 65 on anticoagulants = go to ER even if feel fine
Concussion symptomatic not clinical diagnosis - must rest or body enforces rest
Stay off screens and mental stimulation - very hard in modern life
Tuesday: Full coaching day (acquisition, career, product launch, positioning), wiped out after
Normal relaxation = pick up phone and scroll - can't do that now
Very humbling and grounding - back in touch with body rhythms
Running at very different pace this week
gilFriend.reflection: National level: 'Nobody's doing anything' meme vs lots actually happening (Heather Cox Richardson)
gilFriend.blueStates: Glad to see state's rights shifting to blue states - WA, OR, CA, IL mounting resistance

robOKeefe.update: DC federal government shutdown concerns, daughter at NYU
keyPoints: Canceled work meeting to join call
Lives in DC, feels like attention fading since Elon left
Continued attacks on federal government workers who give lives to service
Government shutdown coming end of September - most think it will happen
Partial or complete shutdown - figuring out who's 'essential' (thanks for label!)
Company does federal consulting, probably won't be impacted
Daughter sophomore at NYU film school
Top jobs AI will replace - but world needs storytellers
Already sick of AI-generated stuff, appreciation for authentic art
Daughter interested in documentaries, watches few movies, loves Broadway
New York energy unmatched - all economic statuses co-mingled
DC and NYC labeled crime-ridden but not true - people buy headlines
Concentrations of artists, musicians, restaurants, creativity
Limiting information feeds, being selective, reflecting for clarity beyond headlines
robOKeefe.tone: Concerned about DC, optimistic about daughter's storytelling future

klausMager.update: Giving up on federal food policy, building AI-assisted regenerative food system
keyPoints: Sierra Club advisory team, Farm Bill Policy, Citizen Climate Lobby, Alcoa
Stepped way back - 'complete waste of time'
Sierra Club sends lobby team to Congress who just cashed $500K check from lobbyist
Current administration destructiveness in food system
Food system: massive environmental degradation, pollution, chemicals, horror show
Scale increasing - doubling down on harmful practices
Working with AI to build intelligence for transition to regenerative
6 years training with Gene Bellinger on systems thinking
Systems perspective: farmer to consumer, entire supply chain
AI objected to 'training' - it's 'configuration process' not training
Configured 6 agents: farm to market progression
Total systems reconfiguration process
Regenerative movement splintered - groups everywhere doing good work but not scalable
Not sharing learnings in organized fashion
AI solution: few keywords on websites, AI finds you within bioregion
Don't need massive database
klausMager.tone: Frustrated with federal system, energized by AI systems approach
